title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel about the decadence and moral decay of the American Dream in the Roaring Twenties.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A powerful story of racial injustice and moral growth in a small Southern town.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy adventure novel featuring Bilbo Baggins on a journey to the Lonely Mountain.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A novel narrated by a disenchanted teenager as he roams the streets of New York City.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone updated
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, where young Harry discovers his magical heritage.

title: Adarsha Hindu Hotel
author: Bibhutibhushan Bandyopadhyay
description: Adarsha Hindu Hotel (Ideal Hindu Hotel) is a Bengali novel written by Bibhutibhushan Bandyopadhyay. The novel was first published in 1940

title: Gitanjali updated title
author: Rabindranath Tagore
description: Gitanjali is a collection of poems by the Bengali poet Rabindranath Tagore.

title: Vande Mataram update
author: Chandra Chatterjee
description: Vande Mataram is a poem written in Sanskrit and Sanskritised Bengali by Bankim Chandra Chatterjee in the 1870s. The first two verses of the poem were adopted as the National Song of India..

title: Shesher Kabita
author: Rabindranath Tagore
description: Shesher Kabita is a novel by Rabindranath Tagore. The novel was serialised in 1928, from Bhadra to Choitro in the magazine Probashi, and was published in book form the following year.

title: chelebela
author: Rabindranath Tagore
description: Anandamath is a Bengali historical novel, written by Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay and published in 1882. It is inspired by and set in the background of the Sannyasi Rebellion in the late 18th century

title: Himu
author: Humayun Ahmed
description: Himu or Himaloy is a fictional character created by the Bangladeshi writer Humayun Ahmed who appears in a disjunct series of novels

title: Ami
author: Humayun Ahmed
description: Humayun Ahmed was a Bangladeshi novelist, dramatist, screenwriter, filmmaker, songwriter, scholar, and academic. His breakthrough was his debut novel Nondito Noroke published in 1972

title: Nondite Noroke
author: Humayun Ahmed
description: Nondito Noroke is a 1972 novel by Bangladeshi author Humayun Ahmed. Ahmed wrote this debut novel in 1970 while he was an undergraduate student at the University of Dhaka.
